result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: from Plea/Sentencing & Sentencing After Revocation Hearing held on May 28, 2015 - original filed in 14CF239
Statement Regarding Recusal - original filed in 14CF239

Defendant David W. Adams in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant David W. Adams in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
9:34 a.m. case is called 
14cm73, 14CF239, 14CF337, 14CF338, 15CF68
Appearances are stated on the record by ADA Knaapen.
Parties are anticipation of plea/sentencing 
ADA Knaapen recites the agreement  in 14CF239:  CT 2 - plea; Ct 3 - plea with repeater enhancer; Ct 1 - DRI
Sentence on Ct. 2; 5 mo jail - imposed and stayed; sentence withheld on count 2, probation for 24 months
Conditions of probation:  Fine of $500 plus costs include DNA surcharge and domestic abuse charge; apply any bond money; 
AODA unless one has been completed and comply with treatment as result of treatment;  maintain absolute sobriety; obtain or maintain full time employment
Complete domestic abuse alternative program and any other counseling recommended by counsel; provide DNA sample; NO contact with Rachel Adams unless approve by agent; Contact with children would have to be with a person approved by agent

Pay Court costs on bailjumping

14CF337:  Plea to Ct with repeater enhancer - withheld sentence; 
24 mos concurrent probation with Same conditions of probation

15CF68:  Plea to Count 2 with repeater;  State moves to dismiss the repeat enhancer; Ct 1, 3 & 4 are DRI;
w/h sentence
24 mos probation: Pay Court costs; DNA surcharge and Domestic abuse surcharge

14CF338: Both counts DRI

Defendant plea:  
14CF239
Ct 2 as a repeater - NC
Ct. 3 as a repeater - NC

14CF337
Felony bailjumping as repeater - NC

15CF68:  Ct 2 felony bailjumping as repeater - NC
On the motion of state, the charge of dangerous weapon is stricken

Defendant verifies signature on Plea Questionnaire.  
Court questions Defendant regarding plea and plea questionnaire
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.

Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
Defendant does not make a statement as to the facts.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

14CF239
Court questions re: previous conviction of 2012 - defendant agrees
Ct. 2 - found guilty 947.01(1) 973.055(1) and 939.62(1)(b) & (2)
Ct. 3 - found guilty misdemeanor bailjumping as repeater 
Ct 1 - DRI

14CF337
Court finds guilty of felony bailjumping as repeater 

15CF68
Court finds guilty under count 2 of felony bailjumping as repeater 
On the Motion of state, counts 1, 3 & 4 are DRI

14CF338 cts 1 & 2 are DRI

No request for PSI by either attorney

ADA Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant does not make statement.

BY THE COURT:
14CF239
Ct 2 - 150 days in county jail w/huber privileges for work and any AODA treatment - STAYED
Probation - 24 mos.
Conditions:
--Fine $500 plus costs
--Pay DNA surchage and domestic abuse surcharge
--Apply bond to fine and costs and surcharges and balance to be paid within 60 days from today
--AODA assessment and comply with any recommendations and provide a release to agent if AODA completed so confirm the AODA assessment
--Maintain absolute sobriety
--Maintain full time employment
--Sign a release so agent can determine that he participated and completed in Domestic abuse alternative program
--Participate in any counseling as recommended by the agent
--Provide a DNA sample if not already provided
--No contact with Rachel Adam unless approved with the agent
--Only Contact with children shalll be with a third party and approved by agent unless agent approves some other arrangement

If the defendant successfully completes probation,  the Court will consider early disharage

Ct. 3 - withheld sentence concurrent
Conditions:
Comply with conditions of count 2 and pay costs

14CF337
Sentence w/held
Probation 24 mos concurrent
Condition:  Follow conditions on 14CF239
--pay costs including DNA surcharge

15CF68
Count 2 - sentence withheld
Probation - 2 years concurrent
Conditions:  comply with conditions in 14CF239 and 14CF337
--Pay costs including DNA surcharge and also include domestic abuse surcharge
Status conference on June 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Ryan W. Drengler in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

8:49 am. Court calls case.
Cases heard today are: 14CF239, 14CF337, 14CF338
Atty Knaapen states appearances.
Atty Drengler indicates that it is important that the defendant's spouse's case be resolved first and requests jury trial be scheduled for a later date.
State has no objection.
Jury trial scheduled on 14CF239 only.
Status conference on January 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on November 3, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 20, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Defendant David W. Adams in court with attorney Ryan W. Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 14CF337 and 14CF338

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 20, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 6, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant David W. Adams in court with attorney Ryan W. Drengler. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 14CF337, 14CF338

14CF337:
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.

14CF338:

Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT:  Bonds continued. 
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 6, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Cash bond with wage assigment to total $500.00.

$500 sig bond: 
Comply with all conditions in 14CF239 and in all pending cases.

Court calls case at 1:25 p.m.
DA #: 14PT1672
ADA Knaapen  appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA  states facts for anticipated charges of Bail Jump.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a $150 cash bond:  Comply with all conditions in all pending cases.
Defendant states he has no cash on hand.

BTC:  $500 sig bond: Comply with all conditions in 14CF239 and in all pending cases.
